description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8lk5g","text":"This is the blunting protocol for NEB PCR Cloning Kit (E1202).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"74a5b","text":"Reaction volume may be scaled up or down as necessary. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lhuh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cragb","text":"PCR generated DNA must be purified before blunting by using a commercial purification kit, phenol extraction/ethanol precipitation, or gel electrophoresis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8k3v0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72l6j","text":"Restriction enzyme digested DNA can be blunted directly without purification. The Blunt Enzyme Mix has been optimized in Blunting Buffer, but is also active in NEBuffers 1.1, 2.1, 3.1, and CutSmart™ Buffer in addition to NEBuffers 1-4, BamHI, EcoRI and DpnII unique buffers when supplemented with dNTPs and dithiothreitol. There is a small reduction in ligation fidelity in these buffers. Transformation efficiency is lowest in NEBuffer 1 and 1.1 where the total yield is about 50% of optimum.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":121,"length":15}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"0E4C24C05B064100B25DEFC25DE70D21","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/e1201-quick-blunting-kit"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b989h","text":"Mix the following components in a sterile microfuge tube:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78kpo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"91rcv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold _dt-h-center"},"A_7":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold _dt-h-center"},"B_7":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[288,"187"],"data":[["COMPONENT","AMOUNT"],["Purified DNA (up to 5 µg)","1-19 µl"],["10X Blunting Buffer","2.5 µl"],["1 mM dNTP Mix","2.5 µl"],["Blunt Enzyme Mix","1.0 µl"],["Sterile dH20","variable"],["Total volume","25 µl"]],"guid":"1F2DE49085A911EAAE53CBAD991588B0","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["COMPONENT","AMOUNT"],["Purified DNA (up to 5 µg)","1-19 µl"],["10X Blunting Buffer","2.5 µl"],["1 mM dNTP Mix","2.5 µl"],["Blunt Enzyme Mix","1.0 µl"],["Sterile dH20","variable"],["Total volume","25 µl"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7cjjd","text":"Determine whether your reactions are using DNA digested by restriction enzymes or are sheared/nebulized or PCR products and move forward with the following steps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ge9e","text":" ether you are using ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9ata3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5qg3b","text":"PCR generated DNA must be purified before blunting by using a commercial purification kit, phenol extraction/ethanol precipitation, or gel electrophoresis. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":15,"offset":121}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"815kd","text":"Restriction enzyme digested DNA can be blunted directly without purification. The Blunt Enzyme Mix has been optimized in Blunting Buffer, but is also active in NEBuffers 1.1, 2.1, 3.1, and CutSmart™ Buffer in addition to NEBuffers 1-4, BamHI, EcoRI and DpnII unique buffers when supplemented with dNTPs and dithiothreitol. There is a small reduction in ligation fidelity in these buffers. Transformation efficiency is lowest in NEBuffer 1 and 1.1 where the total yield is about 50% of optimum.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"url":"https://www.neb.com/products/e1201-quick-blunting-kit"},"mutability":"","type":"link"}}}}}}
